description: From Middle English heeren, from Old English hǣren (“made of hair”), from Proto-West Germanic *hārīn, equivalent to hair +‎ -en (“made of”). Cognate with Scots hairen, hairn, herin (“made of hair”), German hären (“made of hair”).

adjectives.description: hairen (comparative more hairen, superlative most hairen)

entries.meaning: (now chiefly dialectal) Consisting or made of hair
